      • queryRDF

        public java.lang.String queryRDF(java.lang.String s,
                        java.lang.String p,
                        java.lang.String o,
                        java.lang.String s_type,
                        java.lang.String o_type)
        Perform the RDF-QUERY procedure Check the error state with the functions: getErrMess, getErrID
        Specified by:
        queryRDF in interface iKPIC
        Parameters:
        s - the string representation of the subject. The value 'null' means any value
        p - the string representation of the predicate. The value 'null' means any value
        o - the string representation of the object. the value 'null' means any value
        s_type - the string representation of the subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        o_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

      • queryRDF

        public java.lang.String queryRDF(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> queryList)
        Perform the RDF Query procedure Check the error state with the functions: getErrMess, getErrID
        Specified by:
        queryRDF in interface iKPIC
        Parameters:
        queryList - It is a structure to store every triple. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by five string elements : -the subject -the predicate -the object -the subject type -the object type A null value for subject, predicate or object means any value
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

        New value to insert:

        Specified by:
        update in interface iKPIC
        Parameters:
        sn - the string representation of the subject.
        pn - the string representation of the predicate.
        on - the string representation of the object.
        sn_type - the string representation of the subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        on_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal Old value to replace:

      • update

        public java.lang.String update(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> newTripleVector,
                      java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> oldTripleVector)
        Perform the UPDATE procedure Check the error state with the functions: getErrMess, getErrID

        New value to insert:

        Specified by:
        update in interface iKPIC
        Parameters:
        newTripleVector - the structure to store every new triple to insert. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by five string elements : -the string representation of the new subject -the string representation of the new predicate -the string representation of the new object -the string representation of the new subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal -the string representation of the new object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal Old value to replace:
        oldTripleVector - the structure to store every old triple to replace. Each element of the vector contains another vector formed by five string elements : -the string representation of the old subject -the string representation of the old predicate -the string representation of the object -the string representation of the old subject type. Allowed values are: uri, literal -the string representation of the old object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a string representation of the XML answer message from the SIB

      • subscribeRDF

        public java.lang.String subscribeRDF(java.lang.String s,
                            java.lang.String p,
                            java.lang.String o,
                            java.lang.String o_type)
        Perform the SUBSCRIBE procedure Check the error state with the functions: getErrMess, getErrID
        Specified by:
        subscribeRDF in interface iKPIC
        Parameters:
        s - the string representation of the subject. The value 'null' means any value
        p - the string representation of the predicate. The value 'null' means any value
        o - the string representation of the object. The value 'null' means any value
        o_type - the string representation of the object type. Allowed values are: uri, literal
        Returns:
        a null value string in case of error otherwise an empty string
